message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.RO 

The paper deals with image alignment, which is a common problem in computer vision. The approach presented in the paper involves learning a linear model to predict geometric displacement as a function of appearance, which suggests that it falls under the sub-categories of computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of a novel strategy for taking advantage of the generative pixel independence assumption, which could be related to artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also mentions the use of geometric warp functions, which could be related to multimedia (cs.MM) and robotics (cs.RO).
